channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15658] RegionServerCallable / RpcRetryingCaller clear meta cache on retries
item.description:
When RpcRetryingCaller.callWithRetries() attempts a retry, it calls RetryingCallable.prepare(tries != 0). For RegionServerCallable (and probably others), this will wind up calling RegionLocator.getRegionLocation(reload=true), which will drop the meta cache for the given region and always go back to meta.

This is kind of silly, since in the case of exceptions, we already call RetryingCallable.throwable(), which goes to great pains to only refresh the meta cache when necessary. Since we are already doing this on failure, I don't really understand why we are doing duplicate work to refresh the meta cache on prepare() at all.
item.summary: RegionServerCallable / RpcRetryingCaller clear meta cache on retries

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This changes RpcRetryingCaller to not pass reload=true to RegionServerCallable#prepare(). This seems like the most conservative approach to avoiding the unnecessary meta cache clearing on retries.

Most of the code is in refactoring the existing test and adding in a new one for this specific case.

Looks good to me, +1.

(in some next patches we should also try to remove these 'reload' and 'useCache' flags, they complicate logic and make the changes fragile IMO)

-1 overall

Take #2. The first attempt broke some handling for region replicas.

This version preserves the check for table status on retry, but eliminates the additional meta cache clearing. This is still bad though, as a retry will still incur a request to meta to check the table state.

+1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Does ITBLL with CM run with this patch? We had discovered weird non-cleaned cache behaviors previously that way.
+1 second version looks good to me.
Skimmed. Looks great. Nice tests Gary Helmling You saw the Enis Soztutar comment above?

I'm running this through ITBLL right now.

In addition, I've done testing of various scenarios on a cluster with live traffic:

  1. simulating high load so that CQTBE is thrown, triggering non-meta-clearing retries. Verified that no additional calls to meta occurred during this.
  2. graceful rolling / hard killing regionservers. This of course triggered calls to meta, but verified that clients recovered normally with region movement.
  3. rolling masters (hosting meta). Again verified no clients were stuck.

I should have ITBLL results soon.
The LinkVerifier job failed when committing output due to the number of counters, but it looks like the verification itself succeeded. Going to go ahead and commit this.

Committed to branch-1.3+.

Sean Busbey any objections to including this in branch-1.2? It's a change in the prior behavior, but CallQueueTooBigException, which was introduced in 1.2, can make retries more likely in loaded scenarios, and exacerbate the old meta cache clearing behavior.

Sean Busbey if you want this in 1.2, let me know and I will do a backport JIRA. It should apply without any changes.
